pros: Nice people working around, great work culture
cons: No cons. Everything seems fine to me

job_title: Clinical Exercise Physiologist in Bremerton, WA
pros: Pace of job was busy
cons: The job was underpaid a bit

pros: Good benefits---medical,dental,vision,401k, PTO and sick leave
cons: Have changed ownership 3 times in 15 years

pros: Smaller hospital with a community feel, but plenty of varied opportunity
cons: Comparitively low pay, vs compensation in Seattle hospitals

review_title: Great place to work, but does have some drawbacks.....
pros: The people I worked with as a traveler were wonderful to work with. Some of the best people I have ever worked with. You have to remember I am a traveler and have nothing to gain or lose by my review of this company. Plus I was only there for 13 weeks.
cons: The pharmacy there is pathetic. I have had to wait hours for medications to come up to the floor that were due. It takes multiple messages sent to them to get your medicatiomns. In the 13 weeks I worked there, I had more late medications than I have had in the last several years and it can all be blamed on a pharamcy that just can't do their job in a timely manner. It is by far the worst pharmacy I have ever worked with, bar none! If there was one reason that I wouldn't stay there for another contract, the pharmacy would be the reason. Not putting up with them for another day!

review_title: Toxic at all levels...stay away for work and as a patient. I would do zero stars if possible.
pros: This hospital is struggling and I don't think there is a lot of positives about this hospital. Maybe the new site in 2020 could help turn around the negative culture.
cons:
Negative Patient Experiences to frequently.
Front Line Staff in most departments can't play as a team.
Issues with union create a negative environment. There is a lot of management versus staff issues in departments which creates barriers and slows down progress.
Departments often don't get along and never manage up each other.
Turnover is high even with management on all levels. Almost 5 departments in a year were fully wiped out and reconstructed with less managers.
Staffing is very poor and people are over worked. Sadly with CHI this will only get worse as they will continue to reduce staffing for profits.

Overall you will likely have a negative experience with this hospital as it's toxic on all levels. Don't be fooled by any other review as this is the reality.

review_title: The worst work experience I have ever had.
pros: Compensation is OK, the people who work there are exceptional. They really try hard and support each other.
cons: Management does not care about employees. Unsafe practices put an RN's license at risk. Substandard care and not having necessary equipment to perform a task. Every day, completing the simplest nursing function is a challenge and even if you want to give the best nursing care possible, the institution presents so many obstacles it is just impossible. I really feel bad for the patients that end up there.

review_title: Nice place, liked job, Upper management not so.
pros: Nice small town feel, everybody knows everybody, might be hard for a new person to become an insider. Beautiful mountains, water, little traffic compared to Seattle. Just a ferry ride to Seattle which I think is really cool.
cons: Upper management for sure. Immediate supervisor was real nice at first, then communication broke down, then she dissed me. Next thing I knew I  was being written up for other people's errors and for doing my job and following the law!

pros: Staff friendly, supportive, salary good, work hours favorable.
cons: MIA  CEO, facility chronically missing, not stocking supplies. The computer system is a disaster, every upgrade is notoriously labeled a downgrade, non functional everyday in some fashion. Fails to follow their own dogma they push on employees, CHI Fransican. HR is downright evil, backstabbing entity.

review_title: One more lost due to horrible management
job_title: Case Manager RN in Bremerton, WA
pros: Close to home.  Reasonable salary. Adequate insurance.
cons: Horrible management!  Staff that were unable / unwilling to do the job well had no repercussions (and those that were capable were expected to do their own jobs AND clean up for the bad employees).

pros: Harrison is on a journey to excellence and it has been a privilege to be part of it and to serve the patients and coworkers
cons: Like many journeys, it is exciting and takes added focus to implement change. If you want to coast across the finish line this place is not for you. If you are looking challenge and the leadership to back up your skill and passion, consider giving them a second look.

review_title: Merge with CHI making working conditions worse than ever.
pros: Coworkers and immediate supervisor are outstanding.  Moving hospital to Silverdale within the next two years. Most equipment is fairly new.
cons: Mismanaged, understaffed, underpaid. Benefits ok, not great. Building is old.  It's freezing wherever you go. Scheduling is inconsistent, mainly because there is not enough staff to fill all shifts.

pros: Only reason to work there is fellow staff, friendly and really care about the patients.
cons: Administration in this hospital is horrendous and getting worse with the "take over" by the Franciscan system, it is not a "affiliation". The community had some relevant concerns with this take over and they are playing out as expected behind the scenes. You would think the Administrative body in this facility would treat their front line a little better since reimbursement depends on patient satisfaction scores, but they truly don't seem to care at all.

pros: This hospital has a solid Heart program, Cardiovascular program and Ortho program. Great employees and good RN support. Wonderful New Grad resident program, they use "Versant" which is a well structured program.  The hospital is not top heavy with management.
cons: This hospital is old and has 2 patients to a room. However it is in the works to build a brand new facility close by

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Bremerton, WA
pros: Management in the Supper Services building are pretty great. They speak to you like an equal and are very understanding.
cons: The pay is low compared to what I'm used to and the benefits are an embarassment

pros: Family atmosphere, low turnover, better than average nurse to patient ratios.
cons: People are allowed to remain in positions when they don't perform. Low performers are kept in busy environments and not held accountable for their poor performance.

review_title: It was great! Leniant supervisor, great compromise, and I enjoyed working.
pros: There was really good training, and you can get your college paid for.
cons: The new system is sorta confusing.

pros: Excellent medical benefits and retirement.
cons:
Very divided department. ...disorganized. Alot of good RT's....but many bullies that treat new people like crap. Drama and gossip is rampant and none of these things discouraged by management. 
many promises made and not honored. .....a terrible place to work.

pros: Most everyone is nice and friendly.   Good teamwork on our general team.
cons: Sometimes we are slow and get sent home, but early is not always bad

job_title: Certified Surgical Technologist in Bremerton, WA
pros: Friendly surgeons, flexible schedule for family life
cons: Staff is basically like high school, worst place I’ve ever worked

job_title: Executive Director Tech in SeaTac, WA
pros: Great Coworkers, lots of scope of practice as a Tech.
cons: Breaks are considered an endangered species. Management worried about the bottom line a lot.

pros: Staff is the ONLY enjoyable thing here
cons: Horrendous, missing management don't have a clue on how to manage a hospital

pros: Good staff that acts as a family
cons: Management is very worried about the bottom line.

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Bremerton, WA
pros: a lot of entry level positions available
cons: not easy to move up into management

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Bremerton, WA
pros: Flexible scheduling, good benefits, great pay based on experience and excellent teamwork.
cons: Sometimes understaffed which could be dangerous.

review_title: Like the people, the organization, not so much
job_title: Emergency Department RN in East Bremerton, WA
pros: great co workers, 3 to one patient to rn ratio
cons: very busy, top down management, understaffed

pros: Good pay but not worth the headache
cons: Horrible scheduling, rude co workers

pros: Some of the staff is fantastic to work with
cons: Too many corporate changes all the time

job_title: Patient Access Representative in Bremerton, WA
pros: There are multiple locations to transfer to
cons: Toxic management who pick favorites

pros: Great place to work at
cons: Facility is old, but works

pros: At least you can leave this hospital after your 24 hour shift.
cons: Not a good place for Ob-Gyn doctors--community doctors treat hospitalists poorly and administration is likewise unsupportive of doctors.  Not a supportive work environment--do not recomend.
